results.title: Manyu-Wana (A)
results.brief_description: Set among the red dirt, campfires, rock music and dreaming stories of an Aboriginal community in Central Australia, these programs were produced to help local children learn literacy and maths in their own language, Warlpiri. Scenes around the community, animation, puppet and magic characters are used to introduce letters, syllables, numbers and other maths concepts, and to illustrate story books. Traditional skills and activities are featured in segments on hunting and gathering bush foods, fire-making, traditional ceremonies and painting, and dreamtime stories about the landscape. An Aboriginal “Sesame Street”, this series of programs is suitable for use as a teaching/study resource for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Many Cultures-One Community
results.brief_description: This program looks at the dilemmas faced by many children, teenagers and adults, who are torn between a need to fit in with the Australian way of life and following the customs of their homeland. We meet the members of a Turkish family who share a wide range of problems including a teenage boy who wants to be accepted by his peers, his sister who wants to date boys and his parents who feel that he is ashamed of them and their culture. Issues raised include racism, multiculturalism and assimilation, name calling, the problems of living in a new country, the greater difficulties faced by women, peer group pressure, the generation gap and how migrant parents can cope.

results.title: Many classic moments
results.creator_credit: Da Capo Films, James Sherman and Gary Capo
results.brief_description: ‘Many Classic Moments’ explores the emotional surfing experience of some of the world’s best surfing talent, including Larry Bertleman, Michael Ho, Mark Liddell, Buttons Kaluhiokalani, James Jones and Dane Kealoha. The experiences are linked by their communication of the emotions that make up the thrill of surfing. The tape includes ‘Moments of fear’, ‘Moments of searching and finding’, ‘The Ultimate moment’, as well as a Surf Wars Cartoon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Da Capo Films, James Sherman and Gary Capo

results.title: Manx TT SuperBike for Sega Saturn
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in plastic Sega Saturn games case
results.brief_description:
Set in the Isle of Man TT (Tourist Trophy), the world-famous and demanding motorcycle racing event held on the Isle of Man, this Saturn port of the arcade original has two courses to race on: The Laxey Coast course for novices and the more difficult TT Course. While the TT Course is based on the actual track, the Laxey Coast one is a developer creation, although it draws inspiration from the setting.

The Saturn version adds an Arcade Mode, which mimics the original arcade version and a Saturn Mode, which includes additional features such as practice races and a challenge course. Two-player multiplayer is supported via split screen and the game’s soundtrack can be listened to by placing the Saturn disc in a CD player.

results.title: Manx myths & fairy tales
results.creator_credit: Singer and Friedlander, Queen Elizabeth II High School, Julie Harmer and Caroline Webster
results.brief_description: The Isle of Man is located in the centre of the British Isles. With their strong Celtic influences, the Isle has a strong tradition of storytelling, some similar to other stories from Celtic lands, some unique to the Isle itself. Narrated by Manx students Ben and Sarah, and told by Manx residents, these ten tales capture the essence of Celtic history. Each story is introduced, their origins explained, and then told accompanied by illustrations provided by Manx students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Singer and Friedlander, Queen Elizabeth II High School, Julie Harmer and Caroline Webster
results.description: The Isle of Man is located in the centre of the British Isles. Each story is introduced, their origins explained, and then told accompanied by illustrations provided by Manx students.

results.title: Manufacturing consent: Noam Chomsky and the media. Part 2
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Necessary Illusions, Peter Wintonick and Mark Achbar
results.brief_description: Activating dissent, part two of this inspiring profile on leading US linguist and political activist, Noam Chomsky, continues with him on his travels through Canada, Japan, Europe and across the USA as he informs, challenges and confronts the public and the press. He further develops his analysis of media manipulation and neglect in coverage of Cambodia and East Timor and vehemently defends his controversial support for the democratic right to free speech of the French academic, Robert Faurissson, who maintains there were no Nazi death camps. Part two concludes with Chomsky praising the journalism practised by alternative publishers and public broadcasters.
results.title_for_label: Manufacturing consent: Noam Chomsky and the media. Part 2
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Necessary Illusions, Peter Wintonick and Mark Achbar
results.description: Activating dissent, part two of this inspiring profile on leading US linguist and political activist, Noam Chomsky, continues with him on his travels through Canada, Japan, Europe and across the USA as he informs, challenges and confronts the public and the press. He further develops his analysis of media manipulation and neglect in coverage of Cambodia and East Timor and vehemently defends his controversial support for the democratic right to free speech of the French academic, Robert Faurissson, who maintains there were no Nazi death camps. Part two concludes with Chomsky praising the journalism practised by alternative publishers and public broadcasters.

results.title: Manufacturing consent: Noam Chomsky and the media. Part 1
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Necessary Illusions, Peter Wintonick and Mark Achbar
results.brief_description: Noam Chomsky has literally transformed the study of linguistics and at the same time has emerged as a consistent and active critic of power politics and the media which support it. “Manufacturing consent” explores the political life of this controversial author, linguist and radical philosopher. Part one, “Thought control in a democratic society”, focuses on “democratic” societies, especially the US, where populations are controlled not by force but by more subtle forms of ideological control. Chomsky extensively analyses and exposes the disparity in media coverage of two recent “genocides” - the Pol Pot regime in Cambodia and the Indonesian invasion of East Timor.

results.title: Manufacture: care and use of wood chisels
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Filmm Productions and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: Describes the manufacture of chisels from high-grade tempered steel and the making and fitting of handles. Demonstrates the correct method of sharpening chisels with grinding wheel and oil-stone. Concludes with demonstration showing correct methods of using various chisels on different examples of work.
